Package com.stratic.tpl

Class Template

java.lang.Object
com.stratic.tpl.Template
public final class Template extends Object
A template is an instance of textual source code. It is created by a Factory. It can be used without knowing anything about its textual content, but only the names of the tags and variables.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final class 
    Template.Error
    Exception thrown when an error is encountered during template parsing.
    static final class 
    Template.UnknowTag
    Exception thrown when attempting to access a tag that does not exist in a template.

  • Method Details

    • getTag

      public final Tag getTag(String name) throws Template.UnknowTag
      Get an embedded tag inside this template. The returned Tag can be used future to apply it.

      Using this is recommended when a tag need be applied multiple times in a loop. For example :

      Instead of writing : 
      
 
	    Template mail = ...
	    String[] recipients  = ...
	    for ( int i = 0; i < recipients.length; i++) {
		mail.add("Recipient").set("name", recipient[i]);
	    }
      You can write : 
      
 
	    Template mail = ...
	    final Tag recipientsTag = mail.getTag("Recipient");
	    String[] recipients  = ...
	    for ( int i = 0; i < recipients.length; i++) {
		recipientsTag.add().set("name", recipient[i]);
	    }
      This second form is faster because the "Recipients" tag name resolution is done only once.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the tag to get.
      Returns:
      The embeded tag with the given name.
      Throws:
      Template.UnknowTag - if the given tag name did not exist.

    • create

      public final Template create(String name) throws Template.UnknowTag
      Create a new template using the given tag as a factory. The new template is not inserted anywhere.

      It is a shortcut for the following code : 

         getTag( name ).getFactory().create();
      Avoid to use this shortcut in loops.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the tag to be used as a factory.
      Returns:
      a new template ready to be inserted somewhere else with the add method.
      Throws:
      Template.UnknowTag - when tag with given name did not exits.
      See Also:
      • getTag(String)

    • add

      public final Template add(String name) throws Template.UnknowTag
      Create and insert a new template in a tag using it's default template definition. If there is variables in the nested template they should be filled later.

      It is a shortcut for the following code : 

         getTag( name ).create();
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the tag where to add a new template.
      Returns:
      The embedded template newly added
      Throws:
      Template.UnknowTag - if the given tag name did not exist.
      See Also:
      • add(String, Template)
      • getTag(String)

    • add

      public final Template add(String name, Template tpl) throws Template.UnknowTag
      Insert an existing template in a given tag of this one.

      It is a shortcut for the following code : 

         getTag( name ).add( tpl );
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the tag where to add the exiting template.
      tpl - The existing template to add. It's type can be different than the default one.
      Returns:
      The embedded tag with the given name or null if no corresponding tag is found.
      Throws:
      Template.UnknowTag - if the given tag name did not exist.
      See Also:
      • add(String)
      • getTag(String)

    • set

      public final Template set(String name, Object value)
      Set the value for a variable in this template.

      No error is thrown if the variable did not exist in the template, so you can use different templates with a program that push always the same data.

      Parameters:
      name - Name of the variable to set.
      value - Value to be assigned to the variable.
      Returns:
      this template.

    • get

      public final String get(String name)
      Get current string value for a given variable
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the variable.
      Returns:
      Current value for this variable as a string or null if it is undefined.

    • getObject

      public final Object getObject(String name)
      Get current value for a given variable
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the variable.
      Returns:
      Current value for this variable or null if it is undefined.

    • getFactory

      public final Factory getFactory(String name)
      Gets a factory defined locally in this template.
      Parameters:
      name - factory name composed of tags names separated per dots.
      Returns:
      Corresponding factory or null if no factory was found with given name.

    • getFactory

      public final Factory getFactory()
      gets the factory used to build this template.
      Returns:
      factory where this template come from.

    • getTagsNames

      public final Set<String> getTagsNames()
      Gets the set of valid tags names for this template. This is a shorthand method for : aTemplate.getFactory().getTagNames();.
      Returns:
      a set of strings where each entry is a valid tag name for this template.

    • tagExists

      public final boolean tagExists(String tagName)
      Check if a given tag name is defined in this template. This method is a shorthand for : aTemplate.getFactory().ttagExists( tagName );.
      Parameters:
      tagName - tag name to be checked for existence.
      Returns:
      true if given tag name is defined for this template, else false.

      Throws:
      IOException - When the content cannot be written.
